prompt: <description>**Part 1: Three-dimensional rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom, and a slightly tapered shape** Begin by creating a new coordinate system with the Euler Angles [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] and Translation Vector [0.0, 0.0, 0.0]. To create the first face of the prism, start by drawing a line from point [0.0, 0.0] to point [0.75, 0.0]. Then, draw a line from point [0.75, 0.0] to point [0.75, 0.125]. Continue by drawing a line from point [0.75, 0.125] to point [0.25, 0.125], and then from point [0.25, 0.125] to point [0.25, 0.375]. Finally, draw a line from point [0.25, 0.375] to point [0.0, 0.375], and then from point [0.0, 0.375] to point [0.0, 0.0]. You have now completed the first loop of the first face. Please note that each loop is closed, and the first face should not consist of any other shapes besides lines. After creating the first face, proceed by creating four more lines, each joining the endpoint of the previous line to form a second loop, resulting in a rectangular shape. Now, proceed to create a 3D sketch by scaling the 2D sketch using the sketch scale of 0.75. Next, transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch with the given euler angles [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] and translation vector [0.0, 0.0, 0.0]. Afterward, extrude the 3D model with an extrusion depth towards the normal of 0.0 and an opposite normal of 0.5, using the sketch scale of 0.75. **Part 2: Three-dimensional rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom, and a flat front and back** Create a new coordinate system with Euler Angles [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] and Translation Vector [0.25, 0.0, 0.125]. For the first face, draw a line from point [0.0, 0.0] to point [0.25, 0.0], and from point [0.25, 0.0] to point [0.25, 0.125]. Proceed to draw a line from point [0.25, 0.125] to point [0.0, 0.125] and then from point [0.0, 0.125] to point [0.0, 0.0]. This completes the first loop of the first face. To create the second face, draw a line from point [0.0, 0.375] to point [0.25, 0.375], and from point [0.25, 0.375] to point [0.25, 0.5]. Continue by drawing a line from point [0.25, 0.5] to point [0.0, 0.5], and then from point [0.0, 0.5] to point [0.0, 0.375]. This completes the second loop of the second face. The first and second faces should not consist of any other shapes besides lines. After creating both faces, proceed to create a 3D sketch by scaling the 2D sketch using the sketch scale of 0.5. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch with the given euler angles [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] and translation vector [0.25, 0.0, 0.125]. Extrude the 3D model with an extrusion depth towards the normal of 0.125 and an opposite normal of 0.0, using the sketch scale of 0.5. Join the newly created part with the previous one using the JoinFeatureOperation operation.</description>

Next, transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the euler angles and translation vector defined in the coordinate system. Finally, extrude the 2D sketch to a depth of 0.075 in the direction of the normal. This will create a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom, slightly tilted to the right. The height, width, and length of this part are 0.075, 0.75, and 0.75 units, respectively. Part 2: A Series of Cylindrical Shapes with Varying Sizes and Arrangements The second part is a series of cylindrical shapes with varying sizes and arrangements. Begin by creating a new coordinate system with euler angles of 0.0, 0.0, and 180.0, and a translation vector of 0.0465, 0.2344, 0.0. Next, create a sketch on face 1 with the following loops and circles: 1. face_1, loop_1: * circle_1: Center = 0.0469, 0.0469, Radius = 0.0469 2. face_2, loop_1: * circle_1: Center = 0.1766, 0.0469, Radius = 0.0467 3. face_3, loop_1: * circle_1: Center = 0.311, 0.0469, Radius = 0.0465 4. face_4, loop_1: * circle_1: Center = 0.4557, 0.0469, Radius = 0.0463 5. face_5, loop_1: * circle_1: Center = 0.5965, 0.0469, Radius = 0.0461 After creating the sketch, do not perform any scaling operation. Instead, transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the euler angles and translation vector defined in the coordinate system. Finally, extrude the 2D sketch to a depth of 0.0236 in the direction opposite to the normal. This will create a series of cylindrical shapes with varying sizes and arrangements. The height, width, and length of this part are 0.0236, 0.6426, and 0.6426 units, respectively. Note: The final shape produced by combining these two parts is a rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom, and a curved side.</description>
